Package com.authenticket.authenticket.controller

Class OrderController

java.lang.Object
com.authenticket.authenticket.service.Utility
com.authenticket.authenticket.controller.OrderController
@RestController @CrossOrigin(origins={"${authenticket.frontend-production-url}","${authenticket.frontend-dev-url}","${authenticket.loadbalancer-url}"}, methods={GET,POST,PUT}, allowedHeaders={"Authorization","Cache-Control","Content-Type"}, allowCredentials="true") @RequestMapping("/api/v2/order") public class OrderController extends Utility
This is the order controller class and the base path for this controller's endpoint is api/v2/order.

    • testPDF

      @GetMapping("/test-pdf") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> testPDF()
      Retrieves a test PDF document and sends it as a response to the client.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the PDF document as a byte array and the necessary headers to trigger a download on the client-side.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If there's an error during the document retrieval, a runtime exception is thrown to indicate the failure.

    • findById

      @GetMapping("/{orderId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<GeneralApiResponse<Object>> findById(@PathVariable("orderId") Integer orderId, @NonNull @NonNull jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Retrieves an order by its unique identifier and returns it as an HTTP response.
      Parameters:
      orderId - The unique identifier of the order to retrieve.
      request - The HttpServletRequest containing the user's request information.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the order information as a GeneralApiResponse if found. If the order is not found, a NOT_FOUND status with an appropriate message is returned.
      Throws:
      NonExistentException - If the user is not an administrator and is not authorized to access the order, a NonExistentException is thrown to prevent unauthorized access.

    • findAllOrderByUserId

      @GetMapping("/user/{userId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<GeneralApiResponse<Object>> findAllOrderByUserId(@PathVariable("userId") Integer userId, org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable, @NonNull @NonNull jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Retrieves a list of orders associated with a specific user and returns them as an HTTP response.
      Parameters:
      userId - The unique identifier of the user for whom to retrieve orders.
      pageable - Pageable object to control pagination of the result.
      request - The HttpServletRequest containing the user's request information.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a paginated list of orders associated with the user if found. If no orders are found, a message indicating so is returned.
      Throws:
      NonExistentException - If the user is not an administrator and is not authorized to access orders for other users, a NonExistentException is thrown to prevent unauthorized access.

    • findAllOrder

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<GeneralApiResponse<Object>> findAllOrder()
      Retrieves a list of all orders and returns them as an HTTP response.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of all orders if found. If no orders are found, a message indicating so is returned.

    • findUserByOrderId

      @GetMapping("/find-user") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<GeneralApiResponse<Object>> findUserByOrderId(@RequestParam("orderId") Integer orderId)
      Retrieves the user associated with a specific order and returns them as an HTTP response.
      Parameters:
      orderId - The unique identifier of the order for which the associated user is to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the user information if found. If no user is found for the given order ID, a message indicating so is returned.

    • saveOrder

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<GeneralApiResponse<Object>> saveOrder(@RequestParam("eventId") Integer eventId, @RequestParam("sectionId") String sectionId, @RequestParam("ticketsToPurchase") Integer ticketsToPurchase, @RequestParam(value="ticketHolderString",required=false) String ticketHolderString, @NonNull @NonNull jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Creates a new order for ticket purchases and returns the order details as an HTTP response.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The unique identifier of the event for which the tickets are being purchased.
      sectionId - The identifier of the section where the tickets are allocated.
      ticketsToPurchase - The number of tickets to be purchased.
      ticketHolderString - A comma-separated list of unique ticket holder names (for enhanced events). Optional.
      request - The HTTP request object for the user creating the order.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the order details if the order creation is successful. If there are any validation errors or issues during the process, an appropriate message is returned.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the provided ticket holder list is incorrect or lacks uniqueness, or if the number of ticket holders doesn't match the number of tickets requested.

    • updateOrder

      @PutMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<GeneralApiResponse<Object>> updateOrder(@RequestParam("orderId") Integer orderId, @RequestParam("orderAmount") Double orderAmount, @RequestParam("orderStatus") String orderStatus, @NonNull @NonNull jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Updates an existing order and returns the updated order details as an HTTP response.
      Parameters:
      orderId - The unique identifier of the order to be updated.
      orderAmount - The updated order amount for the order.
      orderStatus - The updated status of the order.
      request - The HTTP request object for the user updating the order.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the updated order details if the update is successful. If there are any validation errors, or if the user is not authorized to update the order, an appropriate message is returned.
      Throws:
      NonExistentException - If the provided order identifier does not correspond to an existing order, an exception is thrown with an error message.
      IllegalArgumentException - If the user is attempting to update an order that does not belong to them, an exception is thrown with an error message.

    • removeOrder

      @DeleteMapping("/{orderId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<GeneralApiResponse<Object>> removeOrder(@PathVariable("orderId") Integer orderId)
      Removes an order by its unique identifier and returns a response indicating the success of the operation.
      Parameters:
      orderId - The unique identifier of the order to be removed.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity indicating the success of the removal operation. If the order is successfully removed, the response includes a message indicating the successful removal. If the provided orderId does not correspond to an existing order, an error message is returned.
      Throws:
      NonExistentException - If the provided orderId does not correspond to an existing order, an exception is thrown with an error message.

    • cancelOrder

      @PutMapping("/cancel/{orderId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<GeneralApiResponse<Object>> cancelOrder(@PathVariable("orderId") Integer orderId, @NonNull @NonNull jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Cancels an order by its unique identifier and returns a response indicating the success of the operation.
      Parameters:
      orderId - The unique identifier of the order to be canceled.
      request - The HttpServletRequest containing the user's request information.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity indicating the success of the order cancellation. If the order is successfully canceled, the response includes a message indicating the successful cancellation. If the provided orderId does not correspond to an existing order or the user lacks the necessary permissions, an error message is returned.
      Throws:
      NonExistentException - If the provided orderId does not correspond to an existing order, an exception is thrown with an error message.
      IllegalArgumentException - If the user does not have the necessary permissions to cancel the order, an exception is thrown with an error message.

    • complete

      @PutMapping("/complete/{orderId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<GeneralApiResponse<Object>> complete(@PathVariable("orderId") Integer orderId, @NonNull @NonNull jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Marks an order as completed based on its unique identifier and returns a response indicating the success of the operation.
      Parameters:
      orderId - The unique identifier of the order to be completed.
      request - The HTTP request from the user, containing user information.
      Returns:
      A response entity indicating the success of marking the order as completed.
      Throws:
      NonExistentException - If the provided orderId does not correspond to an existing order.
      IllegalArgumentException - If the user attempts to complete another user's order or if the user's request is invalid.

    • findAllOrdersByEvent

      @GetMapping("/event/{eventId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<GeneralApiResponse<Object>> findAllOrdersByEvent(org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable, @PathVariable("eventId") Integer eventId)
      Retrieves a list of orders associated with a specific event based on the event's unique identifier.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The unique identifier of the event for which you want to retrieve associated orders.
      pageable - Object containing pagination details for the result list.
      Returns:
      A response entity containing a paginated list of orders associated with the specified event.
      Throws:
      NonExistentException - If the provided eventId does not correspond to an existing event.
